story.storykicker: Sonakshi Sinha will essay the role of a journalist in Sunhil Sippy's Noor. The film is an adaptation of  Pakistani writer Saba Imtiaz's 2014 comedy crime thriller - Karachi, You Are Killing Me!
story.storybody:
Sonakshi Sinha is on a long holiday before she gets back to work. The 28-year-old actor, who is awaiting the release of her two films - Akira and Force 2, has already signed her next film which is set to go on floors in July this year. Titled Noor, the film is an adaptation of Pakistani writer Saba Imtiaz's 2014 comedy crime thriller - Karachi, You Are Killing Me!

ALSO READ: Sonakshi Sinha and John Abraham's Force 2 to release in November

ALSO READ: Sonakshi Sinha to romance Akshay Kumar in Namastey England

And Sonakshi will essay the role of a journalist in the film. It seems the Dabangg actor has finally decided to experiment with roles on screen. After turning a RAW agent in Abhinay Deo's Force 2, Sonakshi will now be seen in a new avatar in Noor.

Trade Analyst Taran Adarsh took to Twitter to share the first look of Noor.

 

First look of Sonakshi Sinha [as a journalist] in #Noor, produced by TSeries & Abundantia Ent. Sunhil Sippy directs. pic.twitter.com/AQNmq2eadL

ï¿½?? taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) June 1, 2016

According to a report in Mumbai Mirror, Sonakshi will essay the titular role in the film adaptation. A source was quoted as telling the daily, "While the book - a coming-of-age story of a journalist named Ayesha Khan -- is set in Karachi, Noor will be based in Mumbai and has the eponymous Noor Roy Chaudhary, a 20-something journalist, at its centre."

The film will be directed by ad filmmaker Sunhil Sippy and Sonakshi will start preparing for Noor as soon as she gets back from her vacation. After bagging Vipul Shah's Namastey England and Abhay Chopra's Ittefaq remake, it seems Sonakshi is in for another meaty role with Noor.

"It's a beautiful story that follows Noor as she navigates relationships, career, aspirations, life choices, infatuations and body image issues. Every girl will relate to her," added the source.

The film is expected to be shot in one schedule and wrapped up by August this year.
story.magazinekicker: Sonakshi Sinha will essay the role of a journalist in Sunhil Sippy's Noor. The film is an adaptation of  Pakistani writer Saba Imtiaz's 2014 comedy crime thriller - Karachi, You Are Killing Me!
story.shortheadline: Noor first look: Sonakshi Sinha to play a journalist in her next
